item.title: [Python] I made a Discord bot in Python that translates when reacting
item.description: Bot like this How to make a bot with Discord is omitted. Read around here. Practical Discord Bot with Python (discordpy explanation) Source code # Load the installed discord.py import discord from googletrans import Translator # Replace with your bot's access token TOKEN ='[bot-token]' # Generate objects required for connection client = discord.Client() # Process that runs at startup @client.event async def on_ready(): # After booting, login notification will be displayed in the terminal print('Logged in') @client.

item.title: [Python] Introduction to discord.py (2)
item.description: #Introduction We run an unofficial server for discord.py (although some developers). Questions are also accepted here. You can also create a personal channel and get support there for those who want long-term support**. If you would like to receive individual support, please enter from the invitation url below and DM to @@Smidora #8931`. https://discord.gg/KPp2Wsu **Please send any questions regarding this article here** About this article This article is a step-by-step article about discord.

item.title: [Python] [Latest version] Use discord.py to make the bot speak at regular intervals
item.description: ## Overview We will explain how to make bot perform periodical processing by using discord.py which is Python’s Discord API wrapper that can describe bot simply in chat tool Discord. Note The code example did not actually work. We modified the code example on April 10, 2020. Assumption discord.py 1.3.0a Python 3.6 Version notes Although disc0.1.2 (so-called async version) has been provided for a long time in discord.
